poem:
"Drollery of Deneuve"

Upon a reel of tedious charm, 
Deneuve's drollery plays its balm,
Catherine, she of Franco-Italian note, 
Herself she plays, no script to quote.

Mirror image of Mastroianni,
Chiara's likeness, startling, uncanny,
In a film, whimsical, narcissist and twee,
The magic of cinema, in family three.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Marcello Mio review – droll Catherine Deneuve best thing in twee Mastroianni family whimsy A peculiar and tiresome piece of cine-narcissism here from Christophe Honoré, based on an insufferably twee kind of cinephilia – yet rescued, slightly, by the down-to-earth drollery of Catherine Deneuve, who is playing herself. Chiara Mastroianni, the Franco-Italian actor and Deneuve’s daughter, is of course very well known for her startling likeness to her father: the film icon Marcello Mastroianni. We". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
